channel.title: Simple Question/Help Needed
channel.description:
Well i'm testing my web applet and when i alter something in my code, and try and re-look at it, it looks the same!
It's like it doesn't refresh and the only way i can see the update is by naming it something different, and making a new class file.
I've tried clearling my cache....and that didn't work.
Thanks!

item.title: Simple Question/Help Needed
item.dc:creator: @supamagier supamagier
item.description:
@supamagier wrote:

Yea, indeed, use IE, that works perfect for me. Always been my favorite browser btw.

Read full topic

item.title: Simple Question/Help Needed
item.dc:creator: @BAsh BAsh
item.description:
@BAsh wrote:

If you use the javascript console you clear the classloader cache and view threads and so on.

Read full topic

item.title: Simple Question/Help Needed
item.dc:creator: @Oblivion1 Oblivion™
item.description:
@Oblivion1 wrote:

[quote=“Javacisnotrecognized, post:3, topic:210453”][quote author=frank_ link=topic=277320.msg2260459#msg2260459 date=1212616614]
firefox is shit at handling applets, you have to kill all instances of it for it to reload the classes
[/quote]

Is it firefox, or the way the JVM and firefox interact? I seem to remember being able to clear a classloader cache or something in the Java cpl that would make firefox reload applets.[/quote]

That true, but firefox does fail when it comes to handling applets of any kind, also WoW; i would say to use internet explorer.

Read full topic

item.title: Simple Question/Help Needed
item.dc:creator: @WoW_sucks Dave
item.description:
@WoW_sucks wrote:

Well let’s say i don’t know how to ‘kill all instances’. What can i do to get around my problem?

Also, which web browser works the best?

Thanks!

Read full topic

item.description:
